definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Guo eat while watching the picture storybook side starch noodles.
sentences.chinese: 郭同学一边看小人书一边吃炒粉。

sentences.english: Not only the children but also their grandma wants to read the picture book.
sentences.chinese: 不仅孩子们想看小人书，他们的奶奶也想看。

sentences.english: I stood at a bookstand reading comic books.
sentences.chinese: 我站在一个书摊旁读着小人书。

sentences.english: I bought the child a picture book.
sentences.chinese: 我给那孩子买了本小人书。

sentences.english: Soon our comic-book library was open to the public.
sentences.chinese: 很快我们的小人书阅览室就对外开放了。

sentences.english: The child pasted a coloured picture in his picture-story book.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子用糨糊把一张彩图贴在他的小人书里了。

sentences.english: I bought a map of the world as well as some picture books.
sentences.chinese: 我买了一张世界地图还有一些小人书。

sentences.english: Jack bought 5 picture books that cost $3 each.
sentences.chinese: 杰克买了5本小人书，每本3美元。

sentences.english: There were only cartoons and comics in Y's memories of childhood.
sentences.chinese: 回忆童年，Y能记起的只有动画片和小人书。

definition: the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature, namely: A Dream of Red Mansions 紅樓夢|红楼梦[Hong2 lou2 Meng4], Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
manuscript copy of a book (before the printing press)
children's game played with illustrated cards/pogs/menko (Japan)
